intro: Geraniospermum setosum, commonly known as the hairy geraniospermum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found growing on rocky soils or in dry shrublands. Its fleshy stems and leaves help it store water, making it well adapted to drought conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
